translation.en: -Mr. Szpilman? -Hello.
I came specially to meet you. I love your playing.
translation.ko: 당신 연주를 듣기 위해 왔어요 팬이거든요

translation.en: -Who are you? -My name's Dorota, Jurek's sister.
-You're bleeding! -It's nothing.
You can write him a fan letter later. This isn't the best time. Come on.
translation.ko: 그만 가자, 도로타 나중에 다시 얘기하렴 지금 이럴 때가 아니야, 가자

translation.en: Jurek, where have you been hiding her?
-[father] I don't know what to take. -[mother] You always take too much.
translation.ko: - 뭘 싸야 할지 모르겠어 - 필요한 것만 챙겨

translation.en: [Regina] How many suitcases are you taking? [Halina] I'm packing my red dress.
translation.ko: - 가방은 몇 개야? - 빨간 드레스를 넣을 거예요

translation.en: [father] And what, what do you think, should I, should I take uncle Szymon's portrait? [siren wails in background]
Take it, don't take it, take what you like.
-Can't you see I'm worried sick? -Oh... He'll come home, he'll be alright.
translation.ko: 내가 걱정하는 게 안 보여? 걘 집에 올 거야 괜찮을 거야

translation.en: [Halina] We should have another case just for shoes.
Wladek, oh! Mama, Wladek's home!
translation.ko: 신발 가방을 따로 챙겨야겠어요 엄마, 큰 오빠가 왔어요

translation.en: Oh! Thank God. Wladek! You're wounded?
translation.ko: 다행이네, 블라딕 - 다쳤구나 - 아뇨, 별거 아니에요

translation.en: No, no, no, it's a little cut, it's nothing.
Oh, I've been worried sick.
translation.ko: - 얼마나 걱정했는데 - 엄마에게 걱정하지 말라고 했어

translation.en: I told her not to worry. You had your papers on you.
translation.ko: - 얼마나 걱정했는데 - 엄마에게 걱정하지 말라고 했어 신분증을 갖고 다니니까

translation.en: If you'd been hit by a bomb, they'd have known where to take you.
translation.ko: 폭탄에 맞는다 해도 집으로 연락할 거 아니야

translation.en: -[Halina laughs] -Henryk, Henryk, don't say things like... don't say things like that.
translation.ko: 헨릭, 그런 끔찍한 소리는 하지 마

translation.en: -[father] I can't find anything. -God forbid. God forbid.
translation.ko: - 아무것도 못 찾겠네 - 그런 일은 없을 거야

translation.en: -Papa, Wladek's home. -What did I tell you?
translation.ko: - 아빠, 오빠가 왔어요 - 내가 뭐라고 그랬어?

translation.en: -[Wladek] What are you doing? -[Regina] What's it look like we're doing?
[Halina] Has anybody seen my hat with the wide brim?
translation.ko: 챙이 넓은 모자 본 사람 있어요?

translation.en: I don't know they bombed us, we're off the air.
translation.ko: 못 봤어 폭탄 때문에 방송이 끊겼어

translation.en: Warsaw's not the only radio station.
Ah? Pack, pack, darling. Get your things, pack.
translation.ko: 바르샤바 말고도 다른 방송이 있잖아 - 너도 어서 짐 싸 - 어딜 가게요?

translation.en: -Where are we going? -Pfff. Out of Warsaw.
translation.ko: - 너도 어서 짐 싸 - 어딜 가게요? - 바르샤바 시외로 - 시외 어디로요?

translation.en: -Out of Warsaw where? -[Regina] You haven't heard?
translation.ko: - 바르샤바 시외로 - 시외 어디로요? - 못 들었니? - 뭘 못 들어요?

translation.en: -Heard what? -Haven't you seen the paper?
-Oh, where's the paper? -I used it for packing.
translation.ko: 그릇과 식기는 따로 싸렴 - 신문 어딨어? - 짐 싸는 데 썼어

translation.en: [sirens wail nearby]
translation.ko: - 신문 어딨어? - 짐 싸는 데 썼어

translation.en: Oh, she used it for packing. [father] The government's moved to Lublin.
All able bodied men must leave the city,
translation.ko: 신체 건강한 남자들은 도시를 떠나 강을 건너서

translation.en: go across the river and set up a new line of defense, that's what it said.
translation.ko: 신체 건강한 남자들은 도시를 떠나 강을 건너서 새 방어선을 세우라는 공고였어

translation.en: There's hardly anybody left in this building only the women the men have gone.
translation.ko: 이 건물에 남은 사람은 거의 없어 여자들만 남았단다 남자들은 다 떠났다고

translation.en: And what do you think you'll do while you're setting up a new line of defense?
translation.ko: 여기서 새 방어선을 세우는 동안 우린 뭐 하고 있을 것 같아요?

translation.en: -Wonder around lugging your suitcases? -[mother] Pack, Wladek. There's no time.
translation.ko: 짐가방 들고 떠돌고 있게요? - 짐 싸, 시간이 없어 - 아무 데도 안 갈 거예요

translation.en: -I'm not going anywhere. -Good! I'm not going anywhere either!
translation.ko: - 짐 싸, 시간이 없어 - 아무 데도 안 갈 거예요 잘됐다 - 나도 안 갈래요 - 쓸데없는 소리 하지 마

translation.en: [mother] Don't be ridiculous, we've got to keep together.
translation.ko: - 나도 안 갈래요 - 쓸데없는 소리 하지 마 식구끼리 함께 있어야지

translation.en: No, no, look, look.
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼요, 어차피 죽을 거면 집에서 죽고 싶어요

translation.en: If I'm going to die, I prefer to die in my own home, staying put.
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼요, 어차피 죽을 거면 집에서 죽고 싶어요 - 여기 있을 거예요 - 말도 안 되는 소리

translation.en: -[mother] God forbid. -Sssh! Shut up! I've got something listen.
translation.ko: - 여기 있을 거예요 - 말도 안 되는 소리 조용히 해 뉴스 좀 듣자

translation.en: [radio announcer] ...from the BBC in London.
translation.ko: 방금 들어온 런던의 BBC 방송 속보입니다

translation.en: The British government... having received no reply to the ultimatum presented...
translation.ko: 영국 정부는 독일 정부에 제안한 최후통첩에 답장을 받지 못했기에

translation.en: to the German government...
has declared war on Nazi Germany.
-Oh, oh, that's wonderful! Wonderful! -[radio announcer] It is expected that...
translation.ko: 나치 독일에 선전 포고했습니다 잘됐군 이제 곧...

translation.en: [radio static cross wires with German radio announcer]
[radio announcer] ...within the next few hours,
France will make a similar declaration.
Poland is no longer alone.
[father] It's great, great, wonderful, wonderful!
-Mama, that was a great dinner. -[Wladek] Hm! Yes, it certainly was.
translation.ko: - 엄마, 정말 맛있었어요 - 네, 정말 맛있었어요

translation.en: Well when there's something to celebrate, you've got to make an effort.
translation.ko: 축하할 일이 있으니 공을 들인 거야

translation.en: Here's to Great Britain and France!
[father] I told you. Didn't I tell you? All will be well.
translation.ko: 내가 그랬잖아, 안 그래? 다 잘 될 거야

translation.en: Five thousand and three.
Is that all?
Yes, five thousand and three zlotys, that's all we've got left.
translation.ko: - 그게 다야? - 응, 5,003즐로티 - 이게 전부야 - 3,003즐로티나 초과예요

translation.en: It's three thousand and three zlotys too much. Look...
[Regina] "Re: Further restrictions regarding liquid assets.
Jews will be allowed to keep a maximum of two thousand zlotys in their homes."
-[mother] What do we do with the rest? -Deposit it in a bank. A blocked account.
translation.ko: 나머지는 어쩌지? 은행에 예금해야 하는데 - 계정을 봉쇄했잖아 - 은행?

translation.en: Banks?! Who'd be stupid enough to deposit money in a German bank?
translation.ko: - 계정을 봉쇄했잖아 - 은행? 독일 은행에 예금할 바보가 있나?

translation.en: We could hide the money. Look here. We can hide the money under the flower pot.
translation.ko: 숨기면 되잖아요 돈을 여기 숨겨요 - 화분 밑에요 - 안 돼, 이렇게 하자

translation.en: No, no, no. I'll tell you what we'll do. We'll use try and tested methods.
translation.ko: - 화분 밑에요 - 안 돼, 이렇게 하자 시도해서 성공한 방법을 사용하자 저번 전쟁에 어떻게 했는지 알아?

translation.en: You know what we did in the last war?
translation.ko: 시도해서 성공한 방법을 사용하자 저번 전쟁에 어떻게 했는지 알아?

translation.en: We made a hole in the table leg... [taps the table leg] and we hid the money in there.
translation.ko: 테이블 다리에 구멍을 뚫고 거기다 돈을 숨겼어

translation.en: -And suppose they take the table away? -What do you mean take the table away?
translation.ko: - 놈들이 테이블을 가져가면요? - 가져가다니 무슨 말이야?

translation.en: The Germans go into Jewish homes and they just take what they want...
translation.ko: 놈들은 유대인 집에 들어가서 가구, 귀중품, 뭐든지

translation.en: furniture, valuables, anything.
-[mother] Do they? -Idiot! What would they want with a table.
Hey? A table like this?
-What on earth are you doing? -No, listen, look.
[Halina] This is the best place for it.
[Halina] No-one would think of looking under the flowerpot.
translation.ko: 화분 밑을 뒤질 사람은 아무도 없어요

translation.en: No, no. No, no. Listen, listen, I've been thinking--
translation.ko: 아뇨, 잘 들어봐요 - 생각 좀 해봤는데 - 그래? 너 많이 변했네

translation.en: Oh! Really? That's a change.
translation.ko: - 생각 좀 해봤는데 - 그래? 너 많이 변했네

translation.en: -You know what we do? We use psychology. -[Wladek] We use what?
translation.ko: - 이렇게 해요, 심리학을 이용해요 - 뭘 이용한다고?

translation.en: We leave the money and the watch on the table...
and we cover it like this. In full view.
The Germans will search high and low, I promise you, they'll never notice.
translation.ko: - 너 바보니? - 놈들은 샅샅이 뒤지겠지만 절대 눈치채지 못할 거야

translation.en: That's the stupidest thing I've ever seen. Of course they'll notice it. Look.
translation.ko: 이렇게 멍청한 소리는 처음이네 당연히 알아차릴 거야

translation.en: Look here... Idiot.
[Henryk laughs] And you call me stupid.
No, that is very good because that is the last place--
translation.ko: - 내가 바보라니 - 좋은 생각이야 - 그걸 뒤지진 않을 거잖아 - 오래 걸리잖아

translation.en: -This would take hours. -We are not in a hurry. We'd get it back.
translation.ko: - 그걸 뒤지진 않을 거잖아 - 오래 걸리잖아 - 나중에 천천히 꺼내면 돼 - 시간 별로 안 걸려

translation.en: -It won't take hours. -How will you get them out? Tell me that!
translation.ko: - 어떻게 꺼낼 건데? 말해봐 - 족집게로 꺼내면 돼

translation.en: Tell me that, I would like to know. How would you get them out?
translation.ko: 알고 싶으니까 말해봐 어떻게 꺼낼 건데?

translation.en: -Why do you resist? -[Regina] Quiet! Order, please!
-You take each one out individually. -[Regina] Order please!
translation.ko: - 왜 항상 반대야? - 한 장씩 꺼내야 하잖아

translation.en: No-one listens to me, no one listens.
translation.ko: - 내 말을 다들 무시하잖아 - 조용히 해, 제발 조용히 해!

translation.en: Quiet, please, quiet! Order, order, please!
translation.ko: - 내 말을 다들 무시하잖아 - 조용히 해, 제발 조용히 해! - 다들 진정해요 - 변호사라 명령하길 좋아해

translation.en: -She's a lawyer, she likes order. -Listen, just listen. Look,
translation.ko: - 다들 진정해요 - 변호사라 명령하길 좋아해 잘 들어봐요

translation.en: the watch we put under the flowerpots and the money we stuff in the violin.
translation.ko: 시계는 화분 밑에 넣고 돈은 바이올린에 넣어요

translation.en: -Will I still be able to play? -Well, you'll find out.
translation.ko: 꽉 차도 연주할 수 있을까? 해봐야죠

translation.en: -Jurek? It's Wladek Szpilman. -Wladek, how are you?
Fine, fine, we're fine, thank you. And you?
Fine, we're fine under the circumstances. But I guess what you've called about.
translation.ko: 나도 잘 지내 상황이 이렇지만 괜찮아 왜 전화했는지 알겠는데 어쩔 수 없게 됐어

translation.en: There's nothing we can do. They won't re-open the station.
translation.ko: 왜 전화했는지 알겠는데 어쩔 수 없게 됐어 방송국을 폐쇄해서 다시 열지 않을 거야

translation.en: Just won't re-open the station.
translation.ko: 방송국을 폐쇄해서 다시 열지 않을 거야

translation.en: Yes, I know, but um, Jurek--
translation.ko: - 그건 아는데, 유렉 - 음악뿐만 아니라 전부 다야

translation.en: Not even music, nothing, no radios for the Poles.
translation.ko: - 그건 아는데, 유렉 - 음악뿐만 아니라 전부 다야 폴란드 라디오는 몽땅 폐쇄야

translation.en: I know, Jurek!
translation.ko: - 알아, 유렉 - 그래도 넌 일 찾을 수 있을 거야

translation.en: But I'm sure you'll find work. A pianist like you Wladek!
translation.ko: - 알아, 유렉 - 그래도 넌 일 찾을 수 있을 거야 너 같은 피아니스트라면 문제없어

translation.en: Well, maybe, maybe not, but um...
listen, don't be offended, but I didn't call to discuss my future career.
translation.ko: 기분 나쁘게 듣지 마 사실 일 때문에 전화한 게 아니야

translation.en: I nagged Jurek for weeks and weeks, and at last he gave in and said...
translation.ko: 몇 주나 오빠한테 졸라서 마침내 오빠가 포기하곤 내일 같이 가자고 하더라고요

translation.en: "All right, come with me tomorrow", And so I came and...
translation.ko: 마침내 오빠가 포기하곤 내일 같이 가자고 하더라고요 그날 방송국이 폭격을 당했잖아요

translation.en: they bombed the station.
I tell you, meeting you like that was absolutely wonderful.
-Really? -Yes, it was... It was unforgettable.
I've always loved your playing, Mr. Szpilman.
translation.ko: 당신 연주를 정말 좋아해요, 슈필만 씨

translation.en: Call me Wladek, please.
-No-one plays Chopin like you. -I hope that's a compliment.
translation.ko: 쇼팽을 당신처럼 연주하는 사람은 없어요 칭찬이라면 좋겠네요

translation.en: -Of course, I mean it. -I was... trying to be funny.
translation.ko: 물론이죠, 정말이에요 혹시 모르죠 웃기려고 한 거예요

translation.en: Shall we go to the Paradiso, have a coffee?
I'd like that.
-And you, what do you do? -I finished with the conservatoire.
translation.ko: 당신은 뭘 하죠? 음악 학교를 졸업했어요

translation.en: -You're a musician? -Yes. But only just.
translation.ko: - 음악가군요 - 네 - 하지만 그냥 - 미안해요, 무슨 악기 전공이죠?

translation.en: -What instrument? -The cello.
translation.ko: - 하지만 그냥 - 미안해요, 무슨 악기 전공이죠? 첼로요

translation.en: I love to see a women playing the cello.
Here we are.
NO JEWS
This is disgraceful. How dare they?
translation.ko: "유대인 출입금지" 부끄러운 일이에요 감히 어떻게 이러죠?

translation.en: You know what people are like, they want to be better Nazis than Hitler.
translation.ko: 사람들이 어떤지 알잖아요 나치 횡포 때문에 그래요

translation.en: -I'm going in there to complain. -No. It's better not, believe me.
translation.ko: - 가서 항의할 거예요 - 아뇨, 안 그러는 게 나아요

translation.en: -It's so humiliating. Someone like you! -[woman] Good-bye!
translation.ko: 당신 같은 사람에게 모욕적인 일이잖아요 안녕히 가세요

translation.en: We'll find somewhere else.
-[Dorota] We can walk in the park. -No, we can't.
It's an official decree. No Jews allowed in the park.
translation.ko: 출입금지예요 유대인은 공원에 갈 수 없어요

translation.en: -My God. Are you joking? -I'm not joking, it's true.
I suggest we just sit on a bench somewhere but that's another official decree,
translation.ko: 어디 가서 벤치에 앉자고 하고 싶지만 공공장소의 벤치에도 앉을 수 없다는 명령도 있어요

translation.en: "no Jews allowed on public benches".
translation.ko: 공공장소의 벤치에도 앉을 수 없다는 명령도 있어요

translation.en: This is absurd!
I'll tell you what we can do. We can just stand here and talk.
I think we're allowed to do that, don't you?
So, you play the cello Dorota. That's nice.
And who's your favorite composer? Chopin? Really? Well...
you'll have to learn to play his cello sonata, won't you?
And what about you, Wladek? Well...
Perhaps I could accompany you. Me on the piano, you on the cello.
translation.ko: 난 피아노를 맡고 당신은 첼로로 협연을 하고 싶네요

translation.en: Oh, Mr. Szpilman, you're quite, quite wonderful.
Call me Wladek, please.
"Re: emblems for Jews in the Warsaw district.
I hereby order that all Jews in the Warsaw district...
will wear visible emblems when out of doors.
This decree will come into force on the 1st of December, 1939...
and applies to all Jews over 12 years of age.
The emblem will be worn on the right sleeve...
and will represent a blue star of David on a white background.
translation.ko: '흰색 바탕에 다윗의 파란 별을 그려 넣는다'

translation.en: The background must be sufficiently large...
for the star to measure eight centimeters from point to point.
translation.ko: '8cm 크기의 별을 넣을 수 있는 크기여야 한다'

translation.en: The width of the arms of the star must be one centimeter.
The Jews that do not respect this decree will be severely punished.
translation.ko: '이 명을 어기는 유대인은 엄하게 처벌받게 된다'

translation.en: Governor of Warsaw district, Dr. Fischer."
I won't wear it.
translation.ko: - 달지 않을 거예요 - 달지 않을 거예요

translation.en: I won't wear it. I'm not going to be branded.
translation.ko: - 달지 않을 거예요 - 달지 않을 거예요 낙인되고 싶지 않아요

translation.en: [clears throat] Let, let me see this.
Does it say that we have to provide these armbands ourselves?
translation.ko: 우리가 직접 만들어서 착용해야 한다는 건가?

translation.en: -Where will we get them? -We're not going to get them.
We're not going to wear them!
[in German] Why didn't you bow?
[in German] I beg your pardon.
[in German] You're forbidden to walk on the pavement.
[in German] Walk in the gutter!
-Have you seen this? -What, what, what? I'm working. What?
What is it?
-That's where they're going to put us. -What do you mean, put us?
translation.ko: 우릴 가둘 지역이야 가두다니 무슨 소리야?

translation.en: "By order of the governor of the Warsaw district, Dr. Fischer...
concerning the establishment of the Jewish district in Warsaw.
There will be created a Jewish district in which all Jews living in Warsaw
or moving to Warsaw will have to reside."
Look here. "Jews living outside of the prescribed area
translation.ko: 여기 봐 '규정된 지역 밖에 사는 유대인은'

translation.en: will have to move to the Jewish district by 31st of October, 1940."
They won't get all of us. It's too small. There's 400 thousand of us in Warsaw.
translation.ko: 너무 작아서 다 살 수 없어 - 바르샤바에 40만 명이 넘어 - 아니, 36만 명이야

translation.en: No, 360 thousand. So it will be easy.
translation.ko: - 바르샤바에 40만 명이 넘어 - 아니, 36만 명이야 그래서 쉬울 거야

translation.en: [mother crying] What am I supposed to do? Hm? You tell me.
[mother crying] You're a clever man, you'll tell me what I will buy.
translation.ko: 당신은 똑똑하니까 뭘 살 수 있는지 말해줘

translation.en: [father] I do my best.
[Halina] Mama?
Mama, what is it?
[mother cries] 20 zlotys!
That's all we have left, 20 zlotys.
What, what can I buy with 20 zlotys?
I am sick of cooking potatoes, potatoes, potatoes.
That's the price. That's what I'm offering.
My advice is to accept. You won't get more from anyone else.
translation.ko: 파는 게 좋을 거예요 더 줄 사람은 못 찾을걸요

translation.en: -But, it's a Bechstein, Mr. Lipa! -Two thousand. My advice is to take it.
translation.ko: - 리파 씨, 베히슈타인이잖아요 - 2천이에요 받는 게 좋을 거예요

translation.en: [Mr. Lipa] What are you going to do when you're hungry? Eat the piano?
-Get out! -Hey! What's the matter with you?
-Stop it! -We'd rather give it away. Go on, get out!
translation.ko: - 기증하는 게 낫겠다! 당장 나가! - 오늘 밥 먹었어요?

translation.en: Haven't you eaten today? Hm? What you suffering from?
translation.ko: - 기증하는 게 낫겠다! 당장 나가! - 오늘 밥 먹었어요? 무슨 일을 겪고 있는지 알아요?

translation.en: You people are crazy.
I'm doing you a favor. Two thousand and I'm paying for the removal.
translation.ko: 내가 인심 쓴 거예요 2천에 운임까지 낼 거예요

translation.en: I'm not even charging for the removal!
You haven't eaten today. You're crazy.
Take it.
[Wladek] Hello.
Hello. Hi.
I didn't want to come.
I didn't want to see all this, but... I couldn't stop myself.
translation.ko: 이런 걸 보고 싶지 않았지만 나도 모르게 왔어요

translation.en: -How are you doing? -Fine.
Good.
No, not really. They arrested my cousin.
Jurek says they'll let him out.
-This is disgraceful. -It won't last long. Don't worry.
translation.ko: 수치스러운 일이에요 오래 가지 않을 거예요 걱정하지 말아요

translation.en: That's what I said myself. It's too absurd.
translation.ko: 내 말이 그 말이에요 이건 정말 말도 안 돼요

translation.en: I ah... I should go.
Well, I'll, I'll see you... soon.
Good-bye.
Well... to tell you the truth, I thought it would be worse.
translation.ko: 사실 이것보다 더 끔찍할 줄 알았어

translation.en: -Where will we sleep? -I sleep in the kitchen with the girls.
You, Henryk and papa, in here.
Look.
Come and look.
Go away. Go away! Go away!
Papa! Papa! Papa!
-Sell anything? -Just one. Dostoievski, The Idiot.
-Three zlotys. -It's better than yesterday.
Three lousy zlotys. And there are people there making millions.
translation.ko: - 어제보단 낫네 - 3즐로티에 팔다니 여기서 많이 버는 사람은 따로 있어

translation.en: -I know. -You don't know, believe me.
They bribe the guards, the guards turn a blind eye.
They're bringing in cartloads of food, tobacco, liquor, French cosmetics.
translation.ko: 음식, 담배, 술, 프랑스 화장품 등 수레 가득히 들여와

translation.en: And the poor are dying all around and they don't give a damn.
translation.ko: 가난한 자들만 굶어 죽고 본 척도 안 해

translation.en: Excuse me, have you seen my husband, Izaak Szerman?
translation.ko: 실례해요, 제 남편을 보셨어요? 이자크 셰르만이에요

translation.en: A tall, a tall handsome man, with a little gray beard... No?
translation.ko: - 큰 키에 잘 생겼어요 - 미안해요, 전 몰라요 회색 수염이 있어요 - 몰라요? - 전 몰라요

translation.en: -I'm afraid not. -Excuse me. Good-bye.
translation.ko: - 몰라요? - 전 몰라요 실례해요 - 몰라요 - 잘 가요, 잘 자요

translation.en: Sleep well. But, but, but if you see him, write to me, yes?
translation.ko: - 몰라요 - 잘 가요, 잘 자요 남편을 보면 편지 보내줘요 이자크 셰르만이에요

translation.en: Izaak Szerman.
translation.ko: 남편을 보면 편지 보내줘요 이자크 셰르만이에요

translation.en: Why do we have to have a gentile street running through our area?
translation.ko: 왜 비유대인의 길이 우리 지역을 통과해야 하지?

translation.en: Why can't they go around?
Don't worry about it. They're about to build a bridge. Haven't you heard?
translation.ko: 걱정하지 마세요 육교 짓는다는 소문 못 들었어요?

translation.en: A bridge, a bridge a smedge.
[Jewish man] The Germans claim to be intelligent.
But do you know what I think? I think they are totally stupid.
I have a family to feed. I spend half of my time here
translation.ko: 먹여 살릴 가족이 있는데 여길 지나가려고 반나절을 기다려야 하잖아

translation.en: waiting for them to let us through.
[Jewish man] Maybe they think I come here to listen to the music?
translation.ko: 여기 음악 들으러 온 줄 알아?

translation.en: [in German] You're cold?
[in German] Dance!
[mother] Good, they're here.
Yitzchak Heller's been waiting for you.
-What's this about? -[mother] Sit down, have tea.
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이죠? - 어서 와서 차 마시렴

translation.en: [mother] I'll start lunch when the girls get here.
-[Henryk] So, what are you doing here? -[father] He brought cakes.
translation.ko: 여기 무슨 일로 오셨죠? 케이크를 가져오셨어

translation.en: His ah... his father's back in the jewelery business.
translation.ko: 케이크를 가져오셨어 부친이 보석 사업을 다시 시작하셨대

translation.en: He's, uh, doing well, hey, Yitzchak, hey?
[father] Amazing, jewelery.
-We're recruiting. -Who is recruiting?
Don't be clever with me, Henryk. I'm coming as a friend.
translation.ko: 건방지게 굴지 마, 헨릭 친구로 온 거니까

translation.en: [Heller] They're bringing Jews in from all over the country.
Soon there will be half million people in the ghetto.
translation.ko: 곧 거주 지역에 50만 명이 모일 거야

translation.en: -We need more Jewish police. -Oh! More Jewish police!
translation.ko: - 유대인 경찰이 더 필요해 - 유대인 경찰이 더 필요하다니

translation.en: You mean you want me to beat up Jews with my truncheon and catch the Gestapo spirit.
translation.ko: 게슈타포 앞잡이가 돼서 동포들을 곤봉으로 때려잡으라고요

translation.en: -[Henryk] I see! -Someone's got to do it, Henryk.
translation.ko: - 그런 거군요 - 누군가 해야 할 일이야

translation.en: [Henryk] But why me? I thought you only recruited boys with rich fathers.
translation.ko: 근데 왜 나죠? 부잣집 도련님들만 모집하는 줄 알았는데

translation.en: Look at my father, look at us, I mean.
translation.ko: 우리 아버지와 우리 실정을 봐요 - 내 말은... - 그래, 난 자네를 보고 있어

translation.en: Yes, I'm looking at you, that's why I'm here.
translation.ko: - 내 말은... - 그래, 난 자네를 보고 있어 그래서 여기 온 거고 가족 전체가 더 나은 생활을 할 수 있어

translation.en: Your whole family can have a better life.
translation.ko: 그래서 여기 온 거고 가족 전체가 더 나은 생활을 할 수 있어

translation.en: You want to go on struggling for survival, selling books on the street?
Yes, please.
[scoffs] I'm doing you people a favor.
translation.ko: 네, 그럴 거예요 호의를 베풀러 온 거라고

translation.en: What about you, Wladek? You're a great pianist.
And we've got an excellent police jazz band.
translation.ko: 우리에겐 멋진 경찰 재즈 밴드도 있거든

translation.en: They'd welcome you with open arms. Join us!
translation.ko: 자넬 대환영할 거야 우리랑 함께 일하자

translation.en: -[Heller] You've got no work. -Thank you, I've got work.
translation.ko: - 자넨 일거리도 없잖아 - 고맙지만 일 구했어요

translation.en: Yes of course!
I'm sorry, Wladek, he wants you to stop.
[continues playing] Who wants me to stop?
[Jehuda] I always say, look on the bright side.
[Jehuda] You're in a small ghetto with intellectuals, professional people.
translation.ko: 자넨 작은 빈민가에 있지만 지성인이고 전문직이 있어서

translation.en: [Jehuda] You're better off than us. Here in the large ghetto it's a cesspool.
translation.ko: 우리보다 훨씬 나은 사람이야 여긴 큰 곳도 구덩이나 마찬가지야

translation.en: Jehuda, give me something to do.
You're an artist, Wladek. You keep peoples' spirits up. You do enough.
translation.ko: 자넨 예술가야, 블라딕 음악으로 사람들의 사기를 북돋으니 됐어

translation.en: -I want to help, I want to do something. -You're too well known, Wladek.
translation.ko: 뭔가 해서 돕고 싶어요 자넨 유명해서 안 돼

translation.en: And you know what? You musicians don't make good conspirators.
translation.ko: 그거 아나? 음악가들은 음모자가 되는 데 소질이 없어

translation.en: You're too... too... musical. [laughs]
-Who is that? -Symche.
[Symche] Majorek.
[Wladek] There are notices going up. City is to be cleansed of undesirables.
translation.ko: 통지가 올라갈 거예요 불우한 사람들을 정화한다는 소문이에요

translation.en: -No notices going up. -[Majorek] Hello, Symche.
translation.ko: 통지는 항상 올라가는 법이야 안녕, 심헤, 돌렉 지스킨트 부인, 안녕하세요

translation.en: Dolek... Mrs. Zyskind.
translation.ko: 안녕, 심헤, 돌렉 지스킨트 부인, 안녕하세요

translation.en: [Majorek] Jehuda, working hard?
Majorek. This is the greatest pianist in Poland. Maybe the whole world.
translation.ko: 마요렉, 이쪽은 세계에서 가장 훌륭한 피아니스트야

translation.en: Wladyslaw Szpilman, meet Majorek.
-How do you do? -I know your name.
-I've never heard you play. -[Jehuda] Majorek used to be in the Army.
translation.ko: 연주는 못 들어봤어요 마요렉은 전에 군대에 있었어 훌륭한 친구야

translation.en: Brilliant man. The only thing I've got against him is he's not a socialist.
translation.ko: 마요렉은 전에 군대에 있었어 훌륭한 친구야 사회주의자가 아니란 것만 빼곤 다 좋은 친구야

translation.en: [Jehuda] You better go now, Wladek. It's nearly curfew.
[Jehuda] You know how many copies we print of our newspaper?
translation.ko: 우리 신문을 몇 부나 인쇄했는지 알아?

translation.en: [Jehuda] Five hundred.
You know how many people on average read one copy? Twenty.
translation.ko: 한 부당 몇 명이나 읽는지 알아? 20명이고 독자가 만 명이란 얘기야

translation.en: That makes ten thousand readers. These will start the uprising.
translation.ko: 20명이고 독자가 만 명이란 얘기야 신문이 반란을 시작할 거야

translation.en: Majorek hides them in his underpants and leaves them in toilets.
translation.ko: 마요렉은 속옷에 감춰서 화장실에 몰래 배포해

translation.en: -Toilets, huh? -As many toilets as I can find.
translation.ko: - 화장실요? - 찾을 수 있는 화장실은 다요

translation.en: Germans never use Jewish toilets.
translation.ko: 독일놈은 유대인 전용은 절대 사용 안 하거든요

translation.en: -They're too clean for them. -[Jehuda laughs]
[young beggar] Please, Mister, please, one zloty.
translation.ko: 제발 빵 한 조각만 주세요 아저씨, 1즐로티만 주세요

translation.en: [Wladek] Stop it! Stop it!
[Wladek] Stop it!
[Wladek] Come on, come on, come on. Come on boy.
[man speaks in German]
Stand up. Stand up. Stand up!
[man speaks in German]
Please, tonight for once, I don't want anything bad talked about.
translation.ko: 제발 오늘만은 나쁜 얘기는 하지 말자

translation.en: -Enjoy our meal. -Fine, then I'll tell you something funny.
translation.ko: 즐겁게 먹자고 알았어요, 그럼 웃긴 얘기할게요

translation.en: You all know who I mean by Dr. Raszeja?
-The surgeon. -[Henryk] The surgeon.
[Henryk] Well, for some reason, don't ask me why,
the Germans allowed him into the ghetto to perform an operation.
translation.ko: 독일놈이 거주 지역으로 와서 수술하게 허락했대

translation.en: On a Jew? They let a Pole to come in to operate on a Jew?
translation.ko: 유대인에게 수술을? 폴란드인이 유대인에게 수술하게 했다는 거야?

translation.en: He got a pass, that's all I know. Anyway, so he...
translation.ko: 내가 아는 건 통행증이 있었다는 것뿐이야 어쨌든

translation.en: he puts the patient to sleep and starts the operation.
He'd just made the first incision when the SS burst in...
translation.ko: 첫 절개를 한 순간 나치는 불쑥 들어와서

translation.en: shoot the patient lying on the table,
then Dr. Raszeja and everybody else who was there.
translation.ko: 라셰야 의사를 포함해서 거기 있는 모든 사람을 쐈어

translation.en: Isn't that a laugh?
The patient didn't feel a thing, he was anesthetized. [laughs]
translation.ko: 환자는 마취가 돼서 하나도 안 아팠어

translation.en: I said nothing bad, Henryk.
What's the matter with you all, huh? Huh? You lost your sense of humor?
translation.ko: 다들 왜 이래요? 유머 감각이 사라졌나?

translation.en: It's not funny.
Well, you know what's funny? You're funny, with that ridiculous tie.
translation.ko: 웃긴 게 뭔지 알아? 형이 맨 우스꽝스러운 넥타이야

translation.en: What are you talking about my tie for? What's my tie have to do with anything?
translation.ko: 내 넥타이가 어때서? 넥타이랑 무슨 상관이 있는데?

translation.en: -[Wladek] I need this tie for my work. -Your work?
translation.ko: 직장 때문에 맨 거야 - 직장? - 그래, 일 때문이야

translation.en: -Yes, that's right, I work. -Yes, yes, your work.
translation.ko: - 직장? - 그래, 일 때문이야 그래, 형 일 때문에

translation.en: Playing the piano for all the parasites in the ghetto.
-Parasites? -Parasites.
Boys. Boys!
They don't give a damn about people's sufferings.
translation.ko: 남들이 고통받는 건 상관하지 않는 놈들이야

translation.en: And you blame me for their apathy, right?
I do because I see it every day.
They don't even notice what's going around them.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 일어나는지 상관도 안 한다고

translation.en: -I blame the Americans. -For what? For my tie?
The American Jews, and there are lots of them.
What have they done for us, hey? What do they think they're doing?
translation.ko: 우릴 위해 뭘 해줬어? 대체 뭘 하는 거지?

translation.en: People here are dying. Haven't got a bite to eat.
The Jewish bankers over there should be persuading America
to declare war on Germany. [car tires squeal] [engine revs]
[whispers] Lights! Lights!
Shhh. Shhh. Be quiet, Mama, for God's sake, shhh, be quiet.
[engine starts] [car doors slam]
[beggar girl] Matches! Matches!
-Excuse me! -Yes!
-I'm Mr. Szpilman's sister. -Yes, come in. Not you!
translation.ko: - 슈필만 씨의 동생이에요 - 네, 들어가세요 당신은 안 돼요

translation.en: -What's happened? -Oh my God, it's terrible.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이야? 왜 그래? - 세상에, 큰일 났어 - 왜? 왜 그래?

translation.en: -What? -They're hunting people in the streets.
They've taken Henryk.
All right, go home, alright? Go home, I'll take care of it.
translation.ko: 알았어, 집에 가 있어 내게 맡기고 집에 가

translation.en: Excuse me. Have you seen my husband? Izaak Szerman?
translation.ko: 실례해요, 제 남편을 보셨어요? 이자크 셰르만이에요

translation.en: -No, I'm afraid not. -Tall, handsome, a little gray beard.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 못 봤어요 큰 키에 잘 생겼고 회색 수염이 있어요

translation.en: If you see him, write to me. Don't forget. Izaak Szerman.
translation.ko: 남편을 보면 편지 보내줘요 이자크 셰르만이에요

translation.en: What happened here?
They've got my grandson in there. They pick them up, they take them away.
translation.ko: 내 손주를 데려갔어 사람들을 데려갔어 어떻게 하려는지 모르겠어

translation.en: What they do to them, I've stopped believing in God.
translation.ko: 사람들을 데려갔어 어떻게 하려는지 모르겠어 이제 신은 안 믿어

translation.en: Excuse me. Excuse me.
[Wladek] Yitzchak?
Yitzchak? Yitzchak, here, it's Wladek Szpilman!
-Henryk's in there. -I haven't seen him.
translation.ko: 헨릭이 안에 있어요 - 못 봤어 - 데려간 게 틀림없어요

translation.en: -Believe me. They picked him up. -[Heller] Tough luck!
translation.ko: - 못 봤어 - 데려간 게 틀림없어요 참 운도 없군

translation.en: Can you help?
Oh, now you need me, yes, now you need me!
translation.ko: - 도와주세요 - 이제 내 도움이 필요한가? 그래, 이제 필요하겠지

translation.en: Can you help us?
-It costs. -I have no money.
Then there's nothing I can do.
You should've joined us when you had the chance.
-Yitzchak they told me you had influence. -Who told you?
translation.ko: 이츠학, 당신에게 힘이 있다고 들었어요 누가 그랬어?

translation.en: People, people I know. They said you're an important man.
translation.ko: 당신이 중요한 사람이라고 아는 사람들이 그랬어요

translation.en: [Wladek] Yitzchak!
Help! Help! Help! Help! A snatcher! A snatcher! Help, help me!
[woman cries]
-Why did they pick you up? -So you go to Yitzchak Heller?
translation.ko: 왜 널 데려간 거야? 형이 이츠학 헬러에게 찾아갔군 내가 그런 부탁 했어?

translation.en: -Did I ask you to talk to him? -You're out, aren't you?
translation.ko: 형이 이츠학 헬러에게 찾아갔군 내가 그런 부탁 했어? 나왔잖아, 안 그래?

translation.en: Did you beg, did you grovel to that piece of shit, that cockroach?
I didn't grovel, I asked him to help you.
translation.ko: - 비굴하게 애걸했어? - 굽실거린 게 아니라 부탁한 거야

translation.en: What did you pay him?
With what, with what could I pay him? With what?
Every zloty I earn we spend on food.
translation.ko: 번 돈은 전부 음식 사는 데 소비하잖아

translation.en: -I can look after myself. -They were taking you away.
translation.ko: 내 앞가림은 내가 해 - 널 끌고 갔잖아 - 형이랑은 상관없는 일이야

translation.en: It's got nothing to do with you. It's me they wanted, not you.
translation.ko: - 널 끌고 갔잖아 - 형이랑은 상관없는 일이야 형이 아니라 날 잡아갔잖아

translation.en: Why do you have to interfere with other people's business?
translation.ko: 왜 다른 사람 일에 개입하고 그래?

translation.en: You're mad. That's, that's your trouble, is your mad.
translation.ko: 너 미쳤구나 - 미친 것도 문제잖아 - 그것도 내 일이야

translation.en: That's also my business.
translation.ko: - 미친 것도 문제잖아 - 그것도 내 일이야

translation.en: Hey, hey! What's the matter? What's the matter? Are you sick?
translation.ko: 헨릭 왜 그래? 무슨 일이야? 어디 아파?

translation.en: Hungry.
[doorman] Mr. Szpilman!
Employment certificate? What's that mean, no employment certificate?
translation.ko: 재직증명서? 재직 증명서가 없다니 그게 무슨 말이야?

translation.en: You have to have an employment certificate...
to work for one of the German firms in the ghetto, otherwise...
-Otherwise what? -[Henryk] You'll be deported.
-So the rumors were true. -[Henryk] They're going to resettle us...
and send us to labor camps, in the East.
translation.ko: 동쪽에 있는 강제 노동 수용소로 보낸대

translation.en: -And they're closing the small ghetto. -My God!
translation.ko: 그리고 작은 거주 지역을 폐쇄할 거야 맙소사

translation.en: [Jehuda] Wladek? Wladek?
I thought you'd be off on tour playing London, Paris, New York, Chicago.
translation.ko: 런던, 파리, 뉴욕, 시카고로 순회공연 간 줄 알았어

translation.en: -Not this week. -You look terrible.
translation.ko: - 이번 주는 아니에요 - 꼴이 말이 아니군

translation.en: Have you heard the rumors? They're going to resettle us in the East.
translation.ko: - 소문 들었어요? - 소문? 우릴 동쪽으로 이동시킨대요

translation.en: Rumors! You take it all too much to heart Wladek. What's the trouble?
translation.ko: 소문이라니 너무 심각하게 받아들이지 마 무슨 일인데?

translation.en: I, I've been trying to get the certificate of employment for my father.
But I managed to get one for me and the rest of my family,
but I need another one for my father.
-I've been to all the firms and shops... -Why didn't you come to me?
translation.ko: 회사랑 가게랑 다 가봤는데... 왜 나한테 오지 않았어?

translation.en: I didn't know you were in the certificate business.
I'm not, but Majorek is.
Can you help? I have no money.
Please, don't insult us. Can you do something for him?
translation.ko: 우릴 모욕하는 건가? 해줄 수 있겠어?

translation.en: Be at the Schultz workshop tomorrow, four o'clock.
You see what a wonderful piece of luck you've had today?
That's the historical imperative in action! That's why I always say:
translation.ko: 이게 역사적 운명이라는 거야 내가 늘 그랬잖아

translation.en: -Look on the bright side! -The bright side, yes, I know.
-[Majorek] How's your back? -Better.
Better?
Better not ask!
-Thank you. -My pleasure. Won't help you anyway.
translation.ko: 고맙소 천만에요 도움이 안 될 거예요

translation.en: [Majorek] Thank you, Mr. Schultz.
Well, at least we got work in the ghetto. Hey?
At least we are still together.
All out! Into the yard!
We're all employed. We've got work permits.
-Wait. -[gunshot]
Here.
[in German] The rest of you, get dressed and report back here!
translation.ko: 나머지는 가서 옷 입고 여기 다시 모인다

translation.en: Bring your belongings, only 15 kilos!
Where are you taking us?
I'm sorry, I did my best.
I thought the certificates would save us.
Stop it, Wladek.
Let's just hope that Henryk and Halina will be better off.
[Jewish policeman #1] Move on!
[Jewish policeman #2] Come on, come on!
-Where will we be going? -You're going to work.
translation.ko: 어디로 가는 거죠? 일하러 가는 거야

translation.en: You'll be much better off than in the stinking ghetto. Move.
translation.ko: 악취 나는 여기보다 나을 거야 움직여

translation.en: [young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
translation.ko: 내가 왜 그랬지? 내가 왜 그랬지?

translation.en: [young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
translation.ko: 내가 왜 그랬지? 내가 왜 그랬지?

translation.en: Why did I do it?
[young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
[young woman] Why did I do it?
[indistinct chatter] [baby cries] [young woman cries]
[woman with child] I beg you, don't you have a drop of water?
translation.ko: 제발 부탁인데 물 좀 주세요, 부탁이에요

translation.en: Don't you have a drop of water? He's dying.
My child is dying of thirst.
-I beg you. I beg you. -I'm sorry.
Don't you have a drop of water? I beg you.
translation.ko: 물 좀 주세요 - 부탁이에요 - 내가 하는 말 들려?

translation.en: [Dr. Szpilman] Did you hear what I'm saying?
-I'm telling you, it's a disgrace. -I can hear you.
translation.ko: - 이건 수치스러운 일이야 - 자네 말 들었어

translation.en: [Dr. Szpilman] We're letting them take us to our death like sheep to the slaughter.
-Not so loud. -[Dr. Szpilman] Why don't we attack them?
translation.ko: - 에를리히, 소리 낮춰 - 공격하는 게 어때?

translation.en: There's half a million of us here. We can break out of the ghetto.
translation.ko: 우리 50만 명이 넘는데 탈출할 수 있다고

translation.en: At least we can die honorably, not as a stain on the face of history.
translation.ko: 역사를 얼룩지게 하느니 차라리 명예롭게 죽는 게 낫지

translation.en: Why are you so sure they're sending us to our death?
I'm not sure. You know why I'm not sure? Because they didn't tell me.
translation.ko: 나도 몰라 왜 모르는지 알아? 나한테 얘기해주지 않았거든

translation.en: But I'm telling you, they're going to wipe us all out.
Dr. Ehrlich, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to fight?
To fight, you need organization, plans, guns.
[father] He's right. What do you think I can do? Fight them with my violin bow?
translation.ko: 이 친구 말이 맞아 바이올린 활로 싸우라는 거야?

translation.en: The Germans would never squander a huge labor force like this.
translation.ko: 독일놈들은 이렇게 커다란 노동력을 낭비할 리가 없어

translation.en: They're sending us to a labor camp, it's obvious.
translation.ko: 강제 노동 수용소로 보내는 게 당연한 일이야

translation.en: Oh, sure.
Look at that cripple there, look at the old people, the children.
translation.ko: 저기 절름발이를 봐 노인들과 어린애들이 일을 하겠어?

translation.en: They're gonna work?
Look at you! Well, you're going to carry iron girders on your back?
translation.ko: 자네를 봐, 자넨 등에 철제를 얹고 다니잖아

translation.en: Henryk! Halina, Henryk!
[mother] Halina! Henryk!
We heard you were here. we wanted to be with you!
translation.ko: 여기 계시다고 들었어요 엄마랑 같이 있으려고요

translation.en: We wanted to be with you!
[sighs] Stupid. Stupid.
[young woman] Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
translation.ko: 내가 왜 그랬지? 내가 왜 그랬지?

translation.en: She's getting on my nerves.
-What did she do, for God's sake? -She smothered her baby.
translation.ko: 대체 무슨 짓을 했기에 저러죠? 아기를 질식시켜 죽였어

translation.en: They prepared a hiding place and of course they went there.
But the baby cried just as the police came.
She smothered the cries with her hands, the baby died.
translation.ko: 손으로 아기 입을 막았어 그래서 죽었어

translation.en: [Grun] A policeman heard the death rattle and found where they were hiding.
translation.ko: 경찰은 숨넘어가는 소리를 듣고 그들이 숨어있는 곳을 찾았어

translation.en: What are you reading?
"If you prick us, de we not bleed? If you tickle us, do we not laugh?
translation.ko: '우릴 찌르면 우린 피가 나지 않나?' '우릴 간지럽히면 우린 웃지 않나?'

translation.en: If you poison us, do we not die?
And, if you wrong us, shall we not revenge?"
-Very appropriate. -Yes. That's why I brought it.
translation.ko: 딱 맞는 옳은 말이네 그래서 가져온 거야

translation.en: Idiot. What's he think he's gonna do with the money?
Hey boy, come here.
[father] Come here.
-[father] How much for a caramel? -Twenty zlotys.
What? For one caramel? What do you think you're gonna do with the money?
Twenty zlotys.
We've got 20 between us.
I've got ten, I think.
Five, ten, twenty.
[young woman cries] Why did I do it?
[young woman cries] Why did I do it? Why did I do it? Why did I do it?
[German soldiers shouting in German]
[German soldiers shouting in German]
-Halina? -What?
-It's a funny time to say this, but... -What?
translation.ko: 이런 말 할 때는 아니지만... 뭔데?

translation.en: I wish I knew you better.
translation.ko: 널 더 잘 알았으면 좋았을 거야

translation.en: Thank you.
[Heller] Szpilman? Szpilman!
Fuck off stupid! Go!
Papa? Papa?
Papa? Mama? Halina?
Halina? Mama?
What do you think you're doing Szpilman? I've saved your life. Get out just go! Go!
translation.ko: 뭐 하는 짓이야, 슈필만? 널 살려준 건데 일어나서 그냥 가, 어서!

translation.en: [Heller] Don't run!
Mama! Mama! Mama!
-Well, off they go to the melting pot. -Ah! Ja.
What are you doing? She's pregnant!
[Benek] Wladek?
[sighs heavily] Why are you here, Wladek?
It's like this, I, I...
We...
All of them, all of them. All of them.
Perhaps they're lucky. The quicker, the better.
translation.ko: 그들이 운이 좋은 건지도 몰라 빨리 끝날수록 좋잖아

translation.en: It's not finished yet. We'll stay here for a couple of days,
translation.ko: 아직 끝난 게 아니야 진정될 때까지 여기서 며칠 있어야 해

translation.en: until things die down.
translation.ko: 진정될 때까지 여기서 며칠 있어야 해

translation.en: I've bribed a policeman, he'll come when it's over.
translation.ko: 경찰을 매수했으니까 다 끝나면 여기로 올 거야

translation.en: My God, I haven't been outside in, it must be two years.
translation.ko: 세상에, 밖에 나와 본 게 2년이 넘었어

translation.en: Don't get overexcited.
It's gold. Very good price.
Someone you know?
A beauty. Who is she?
She's a singer. I knew her well actually. Her husband's an actor.
translation.ko: - 예쁘네, 누구지? - 가수예요 잘 아는 사이예요 남편은 배우죠

translation.en: They're good people. I'd like to talk to her.
Don't forget, Wladek. They hang them for helping Jews.
translation.ko: 유대인을 도우면 처형당한다는 걸 잊지 마

translation.en: How long have you been here? Since last night.
translation.ko: - 여기 온 지 얼마나 됐죠? - 어젯밤부터요

translation.en: I was pleased to see you.
They're going to start the final resettlement now.
We know what it means.
We sent someone out. Zygmunt, a good man.
translation.ko: 대원 한 명을 내보냈어요 지그문트란 좋은 사람이죠

translation.en: His orders were to follow the trains out of Warsaw.
He got to Sokolow.
A local railway man told him the tracks divided,
one branch leading to Treblinka.
He said everyday freight trains carrying people from Warsaw...
branched off to Treblinka and returned empty.
translation.ko: 트레블링카로 향하고 돌아올 땐 텅 비었대요

translation.en: No transports of food are ever seen on that line.
And civilians are forbidden to approach the Treblinka station.
They're exterminating us.
It won't take them long.
We're 60 thousand left, out of half a million.
Mostly young people.
And this time we're gonna fight.
We're in good shape.
Organized. We're prepared.
If you need help, I...
[Zig-Zag] You! Come here!
Shit!
[Wladek] I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
[Wladek] I, I don't know what I was thinking.
I hope you play the piano better than you carry bricks.
translation.ko: 피아노는 잘 치는지 모르겠지만 벽돌 나르기는 형편없군

translation.en: He won't last long if he goes on like this.
I'll see if I can get him something better.
Trouble.
[German soldier # 2] Round up! Only the Jews. [German soldier # 2] Poles go on working. Only the Jews!
I have good news for you.
There are rumors going around that we like to, uh...
umsiedeln... Resettle you.
I promise you that now and in the future...
nothing else is planned.
Ja? For this reason, we put information posters on the wall.
To show you our goodwill...
you should vote one of you to be allowed...
translation.ko: 당신들이 동료 중 한 명을 뽑아 매일 시내로 보내서

translation.en: to go in town daily...
and bring three kilos of Kartoffeln potatoes, ja?
translation.ko: 감자 3kg 사 오게 할 거야 알겠지?

translation.en: And one loaf of bread for each of your workers.
translation.ko: 일꾼당 빵도 하나씩 돌아가게 할 거야

translation.en: So, why should we do something else like this if we would resettle you?
translation.ko: 우리가 이주를 계획한다면 왜 이런 일을 하겠어?

translation.en: You can make good business out of the things you don't eat.
translation.ko: 자네들은 먹지 않는 것에서 뭐든 돈으로 만들잖아

translation.en: Isn't that something that you Jews are good in? Make money?
translation.ko: 그게 당신 유대인의 장점이잖아 돈 만드는 거 말이야

translation.en: That one, with the string. The others, tied by wire.
translation.ko: 끈으로 묶은 거예요 나머지는 철사로 묶었어요

translation.en: [Majorek] Now!
Majorek.
I have a favor to ask.
I want to get out of here.
It's easy to get out. It's how you survive on the other side that's hard.
translation.ko: 나가는 건 쉬워요 나가서 살아남는 게 어려운 거죠

translation.en: I know.
Last summer, I worked for a day in the Zelazna Brama Square.
translation.ko: 지난여름에 젤라즈나 브라마 광장에서 일한 적 있는데

translation.en: I saw someone I knew, she's an old friend.
translation.ko: 아는 사람을 봤어요 가수인 옛날 친구예요 남편은 배우고

translation.en: A singer, her husband's an actor.
I filled their names down and their address, if they're still there.
translation.ko: 이름과 주소를 적었어요 아직도 살고 있는지 궁금해서

translation.en: Janina Godlewska and Andrzej Bogucki. They're good people.
translation.ko: 야니나 고들레프스카와 안제이 보구츠키는 좋은 사람이죠

translation.en: Would you try to make contact?
You go to town every day.
Would you just ask them, ask them if they'd help me get out of here?
translation.ko: 매일 시내로 나가잖아요 물어봐 줘요 여기서 날 빼낼 수 있냐고 물어봐 줘요

translation.en: [in German] Got a plaster?
[in German] What are you up to?
What's in that?
[in German] We're allowed to take food into the ghetto.
translation.ko: 거주 지역으로 음식을 갖고 가게 허락받았어요

translation.en: [in German] Three kilos of potato and bread.
[in German] Open it.
[in German] It's only potatoes and bread.
[in German] You're lying. I can smell it.
[in German] Potatoes!
[in German] You Jews are all the same.
[in German] Give a Jew your little finger...
and he takes the whole hand.
[in German] Lie to me again, I'll shoot you... personally.
translation.ko: 또 거짓말하면 총살이야 내가 직접 쏠 거야

translation.en: [Majorek] I tried your friends.
-They don't live there anymore. -Did you make contact?
translation.ko: 친구 집에 가봤지만 이사했더군요 연락은 했어요?

translation.en: -Be ready to leave. -When?
-Soon. -[Zig-Zag] Halt!
-[soldier speaking German] -[Wladek] Oh, shit! Shit!
[in German] I'll teach you discipline, you dirty pigs!
translation.ko: 규율이 뭔지 알려주지 돼지 같은 놈들아!

translation.en: [in German] Know why we're beating you?
-[in German] Why? -[in German] To celebrate New Year's Eve.
No, quick march! March!
[Zig-Zag in German] March and sing!
[Zig-Zag in German] Sing something cheerful!
[Zig-Zag in German] Sing it loud and clear! [laughs]
[Column sings] ♪ Hey ranks unite and follow the white eagle ♪
[all sing] ♪ Stand up and fight our mortal enemies ♪
♪ Riflemen, hey! Let's give them fire and brimstone ♪
♪ We'll blow away the yoke of slavery ♪
♪ Punish and rout the rapists of our nation ♪
♪ We'll smash the knout to save our dignity ♪
translation.ko: 체면을 살리기 위해 채찍을 박살 내라

translation.en: I'm sorry. I'm dirty. I'm so filthy. [sniffs]
We haven't much time. Come on.
We must hurry. Here. See if these fit.
[Bogucki] We're going to have to keep moving you.
The Germans are hunting down indiscriminately now.
Jews, non-Jews, anybody, everybody.
And Wladek, you'd better shave. Use my razor on the shelf.
translation.ko: 면도하는 게 좋겠어 선반 위에 있는 내 면도기를 써

translation.en: You'll be looked after by Marek Gebczynski.
He's on the other side of town.
You stay there tonight, then we'll find you somewhere else.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤에 거기 있다가 다른 곳을 찾아줄게

translation.en: -I'll bring you food. -Alright, let's go.
I'll show you where you're going to sleep.
You have to stay here until tomorrow afternoon.
We have a flat for you near the ghetto wall. But it's safe.
translation.ko: 거주 지역 근처에 방을 구했는데 안전한 곳이야

translation.en: It's not going to be very comfortable.
I'll be fine.
Thank you.
I'll take it. Here. Give it to me.
Go as near to the front as possible, to the German section.
translation.ko: 최대한 앞쪽으로 가 독일인 좌석 쪽으로

translation.en: DO NOT PASS
[Gebczynski] I'm going to draw the curtains now.
But you leave them open during the daytime. Don't forget.
translation.ko: 낮엔 꼭 열어놔야 해 잊지 마

translation.en: Must feel better on this side of the wall, huh?
translation.ko: 거주 지역 밖에 있으니 기분이 좋지?

translation.en: Yes.
But sometimes I'm still not sure which side of the wall I'm on.
translation.ko: 하지만 어느 쪽에 있는지 실감이 안 나요

translation.en: [Gebczynski] Some bread, potatoes, onions.
I'll come again. And Janina Bogucki will visit twice a week.
translation.ko: 다시 올게 야니나 고들레프스카가 일주일에 두 번씩 올 거야

translation.en: Bring more food, see how you are.
translation.ko: 음식도 가져오고 자네가 어떤지 보러 올 거야

translation.en: Thank you.
Oh, this is very important. In case of emergency...
I mean emergency, go to this address.
[woman playing kitten's voice next door] Puppy dog, what do you mean you forgot?
[man playing puppy dog's voice] What do you think I mean, Kitten? I forgot, that's what I mean.
[Kitten's voice] You know what, you treat me like dirt.
[Puppy dog's voice] I treat you like dirt because you are dirt.
translation.ko: 날 함부로 대하잖아 당신이 이러니까 그렇게 대하는 거야

translation.en: -[Kitten's voice] Pig! Pig! -[Puppy dog's voice] Bitch!
-[Kitten's voice] Dirty pig! -[Puppy dog's voice] You are a dirty pig!
translation.ko: - 나쁜 년! - 더러운 돼지 같으니! 당신은 더러운 돼지야!

translation.en: [Kitten's voice] Takes one to know one. Pig.
[Puppy dog's voice] Hmm. You play like an angel, Kitten.
[Kitten's voice] If I play like an angel, why don't you listen? [Wladek chuckles]
[Puppy dog's voice] I was listening, Kitten.
[Kitten's voice] Liar! You fell asleep. Pig!
translation.ko: - 듣고 있잖아 - 거짓말쟁이, 잠만 자면서 돼지!

translation.en: [gunshots, rapid gunfire]
[speaking German]
Thank you.
-I wanted to come earlier, but... -No, no, no, thank you.
translation.ko: - 진작 오려고 했지만... - 아니, 괜찮아, 고마워

translation.en: [Janina] No-one thought they'd hold out so long.
translation.ko: 그들이 이렇게 오래 버틸지는 아무도 몰랐어

translation.en: I never should have come out. I should've stayed there and fought with them.
translation.ko: 나오지 않았어야 했어 남아서 함께 싸워야 했는데

translation.en: Wladek, stop that. It's over now.
Just be proud it happened.
-My God, did they put up a fight! -Yes.
-So did the Germans. -They're in shock!
translation.ko: 독일놈들도 그랬어 놈들은 충격받았어 아무도 예상 못 했잖아

translation.en: They didn't expect it. Nobody expected it. Jews fighting back?
translation.ko: 놈들은 충격받았어 아무도 예상 못 했잖아 유대인이 반격해

translation.en: -Who would have thought? -What good did it do?
What good? Wladek, I'm surprised at you.
translation.ko: 뭘 얻었냐고? 블라딕, 그게 무슨 말이야?

translation.en: They died with dignity, that's what good it did.
And you know something else?
translation.ko: 그리고 또 다른 게 있어 이제 폴란드인들도 동참했어

translation.en: Now the Poles will rise. We're ready.
translation.ko: 그리고 또 다른 게 있어 이제 폴란드인들도 동참했어 우린 준비가 됐다고

translation.en: We'll fight too. You'll see.
Get your things together. You have to leave.
p[Wladek] What? What's happened?
-[Gebczynski] I'm on the run. -What's happened?
translation.ko: 난 도망 중이야 - 무슨 일이에요? - 게슈타포가 무기를 찾아냈어

translation.en: The Gestapo found our weapons. They've arrested Janina and Andrzej.
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이에요? - 게슈타포가 무기를 찾아냈어 야니나와 안제이가 체포됐어

translation.en: They're bound to find out about this place too. You must get away at once.
translation.ko: 곧 이곳도 알아낼 거야 당장 떠나야 해

translation.en: Where do you want me to go?
Look at me, I'm not leaving.
-Can I take my chances here? -That's your decision.
translation.ko: - 여기서 운명에 맡기고 싶어요 - 자네가 좋을 대로 해

translation.en: But when they storm the flat, throw yourself out the window,
don't let them get you alive.
I have poison on me. They won't get me alive either.
translation.ko: 독약을 갖고 있어서 나도 생포 당하지 않을 거야

translation.en: [woman] Open up!
[woman shouts] Open this door at once or we'll call the police!
translation.ko: 당장 열지 않으면 경찰에 신고할 거예요

translation.en: Are you from this flat? You're not registered.
It belongs to a friend of mine.
I just came to visit, but I must have just missed him.
Have you got your identity card?
-Let me see your identity card. -Yes, of course.
-I want to see your identity card! -What's happening?
He's a Jew! A Jew!
translation.ko: - 무슨 일이에요? - 유대인이에요 유대인이에요! 그를 막아요!

translation.en: Stop the Jew!
Don't let him out! Stop him!
-[Dorota] Yes? -Mr. Gebczynski sent me.
-Wladyslaw Szpilman. -Dorota.
Come in.
I'm sorry, I'm sorry.
I was given this address and I'm looking for a Mr. Dzikiewicz.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 이 주소를 줬어요 - 지키에비치 씨를 찾아요 - 제 남편이에요

translation.en: Michal Dzikiewicz, he's my husband.
Come in.
Sit.
I need help.
He'll be back before curfew.
I've... I've been in hiding.
-I need somewhere to stay. -He'll be here soon.
translation.ko: 머물 곳이 필요해요 남편이 곧 올 거예요

translation.en: -How long have you been married? -Just over a year.
translation.ko: 결혼한 지 얼마나 됐죠? 일 년 전에요

translation.en: And... how's Jurek?
Dead.
-And when, when is your baby due? -Christmas.
This is not a good time to have children, -[door opens, closes] -but then...
This is my husband. Wladyslaw Szpilman.
translation.ko: 남편이에요 블라디슬라프 슈필만이에요 마렉 게프친스키가 보냈대요

translation.en: -Marek Gebczynski sent him. -Oh, yes, I remember.
translation.ko: 블라디슬라프 슈필만이에요 마렉 게프친스키가 보냈대요 그래, 기억나

translation.en: Mr. Gebczynski said to contact you only in case of emergency.
translation.ko: 게프친스키 씨가 비상시에 당신한테 연락하라고 해서...

translation.en: Don't worry now.
We can't move you tonight. You'll sleep on the sofa.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤은 이동할 수 없으니 소파에서 자도록 해요

translation.en: Oh! Excuse me.
I'm sorry, could I, could I have a piece of bread?
Yes, of course. We'll eat.
Sit. Please, sit.
Thank you.
[Michal] You're in a very German area.
The building opposite is a hospital taking in wounded from the Russian front.
translation.ko: 건너편의 건물은 러시아 전방 부상병들을 위한 병원이에요

translation.en: And next door is the Schutzpolizei.
[Michal] Safest place to be. Right in the heart of the lion's den.
translation.ko: 가장 안전한 곳이죠 사자굴 한가운데에 있어요

translation.en: I'll be locking you in.
No-one knows you're here, so keep as quiet as possible.
translation.ko: 누가 있는지 모르니까 가능한 한 조용히 해요

translation.en: All well?
Thank you.
This is Antek Szalas. He'll be looking after you.
translation.ko: 여긴 안텍 샬라스예요 당신을 돌봐줄 거예요

translation.en: -How do you do? -How do you do?
Thank you.
I've given him a second key. He'll bring you food, see that you're alright.
translation.ko: 이 친구에게 열쇠를 줬어요 음식도 가져오고 당신이 괜찮은지 보러 올 거예요

translation.en: He's with the underground, he's a good man.
translation.ko: 지하 조직에 있는 사람이에요 좋은 사람이죠

translation.en: -You don't remember me Mr. Szpilman? -I don't think so.
translation.ko: 절 기억 못 하세요, 슈필만 씨? - 모르겠네요 - 바르샤바 라디오에서

translation.en: Warsaw Radio. I was a technician.
translation.ko: - 모르겠네요 - 바르샤바 라디오에서 기술자였는데 매일 당신을 봤어요

translation.en: [Szalas] I saw you almost every day.
-I'm sorry, I don't remember, I... -It doesn't matter.
You've nothing to worry about. I'll visit often.
You'll be pleased to hear that the Allies are bombing Germany...
translation.ko: 연합군이 독일을 폭격하고 있다는 기쁜 소식이에요

translation.en: night after night, after night.
Cologne, Hamburg, Berlin.
And the Russians are really giving them hell. It's the beginning of the end.
translation.ko: 러시아군에게도 당하고 있죠 - 종말의 시작이에요 - 그러길 바라요

translation.en: Oh, let's hope so.
Still alive then?
Here. Sausage, bread.
You still got that vodka?
-How long is this meant to last? -Not long now.
translation.ko: - 얼마나 갈 것 같아요? - 얼마 안 남았어요

translation.en: I think, I think I've got jaundice.
Don't worry about that. It just makes you look funny.
translation.ko: 그건 걱정하지 말아요 그냥 웃기게만 보일 거예요

translation.en: My grandfather was jilted by his girlfriend when he got jaundice.
translation.ko: 할아버지가 황달에 걸렸을 때 여자친구한테 채었죠

translation.en: Drink up.
Why didn't you come sooner? It's been over two weeks.
-I got-- -Problems. -Money. -[car door slams]
I've got to raise money to buy the food.
I need things to sell, it's not easy.
translation.ko: 팔 물건을 구하는 건 쉽지 않아요

translation.en: [Wladek] Here. Sell this.
Food's more important than time.
Oh, yes. I meant to tell you! The Allies have landed in France.
translation.ko: 깜빡했는데 연합군이 프랑스에 도착했고 러시아군도 곧 여기 올 거예요

translation.en: Russians will be here soon.
translation.ko: 연합군이 프랑스에 도착했고 러시아군도 곧 여기 올 거예요

translation.en: They'll beat the shit out of the Germans...
any day now.
Wladek?
Wladek?
I knew it. I knew this would happen.
[Wladek whimpers]
-I'll get a doctor. -You can't. It's too dangerous.
translation.ko: - 의사를 불러야 해요 - 그럴 순 없어, 너무 위험해

translation.en: -I'll get Dr. Luczak. We can trust him. -Dorota. Don't be ridiculous,
translation.ko: 루차크 의사를 부를게요 그는 믿을 수 있어요 도로타, 말도 안 되는 소리 소아과 의사잖아

translation.en: he's a pediatrician.
translation.ko: 도로타, 말도 안 되는 소리 소아과 의사잖아

translation.en: -He's still a doctor. -No.
You stay. I'll go.
We came to say goodbye.
We're going to stay with my mother in Otwocks.
translation.ko: 오트보츠크에 계신 어머니 댁에 가 있을 거예요

translation.en: The baby's already there. It's safer.
There's talk that the uprising will begin any day now. [Wladek whimpers]
translation.ko: 곧 반란이 시작될 거란 소문이 있어요

translation.en: That man Szalas should be shot.
He's been collecting money on your behalf all over Warsaw.
translation.ko: 당신 핑계로 바르샤바 전역에서 돈을 모금했거든요

translation.en: Apparently people gave generously, so he collected a tidy sum.
translation.ko: 사람들이 아낌없이 원조해서 돈을 많이 모았나 봐요

translation.en: My God.
The liver the size of a football. Acute inflammation of the gall bladder...
translation.ko: 간이 축구공만큼 부었고 쓸개에 급성염증이 있지만

translation.en: but he'll live.
I'll try to get him some levulose, but it's not easy.
-Can you visit him again? -Who knows.
translation.ko: 또 와주실 수 있어요? - 모르죠 - 의사 선생님

translation.en: -Doctor, thank you. -Don't speak, rest.
translation.ko: - 모르죠 - 의사 선생님 - 고마워요 - 얘기하지 말고 쉬어요

translation.en: Thank you so much for coming.
We've brought you some food.
I'll prepare something now for you, then we must go.
[tram bell rings]
[knock on the door] [man shouts indistinctly]
[man] Get out, get out, get out into the streets! [man] Get out now! The Germans have surrounded the building!
translation.ko: 거리로 나와요, 당장 나가요 독일군이 건물을 포위했어요

translation.en: [Wladek] Somebody... Somebody! somebody help me!
[German Captain in German] What are you doing here?
Who are you?
-Understand? -[in German] Yes.
[German Captain in German] What are you doing?
[in German] I, I was...
trying to open this can.
[in German] Do you live here?
[in German] Do you work here?
[Wladek in German] No.
[in German] What do you do?
[in German] I am...
I was a pianist.
Pianist?
[in German] Come on.
[in German] Play something.
[in German] Are you hiding here?
[in German] Jew?
[in German] Where are you hiding?
[in German] In the attic.
[in German] Show me.
[in German] Got any food?
[in German] Jew!
Excuse me. Please.
[in German] What's all that gunfire?
[in German] Russians. Across the river.
[in German] All you have to do is wait a few weeks.
translation.ko: 몇 주만 더 버티면 될 거야

translation.en: -[Wladek in German] What's happening? -[in German] We're leaving.
-[in German] Are the Russians here? -[in German] Not yet.
[in German] I... I don't know how to thank you.
[in German] Thank God, not me.
[in German] He wants us to survive. Well, that's what we have to believe.
translation.ko: 우리가 살아남는 걸 원하시니까 우린 그렇게 믿어야 해

translation.en: [in German] Here. Take it.
-[in German] And you? -[in German] I've got another...
[in German] a warmer one.
[in German] What'll you do when it's all over?
[in German] I'll play the piano again. On the Polish radio.
translation.ko: 다시 연주할 거예요 폴란드 라디오 방송에서요

translation.en: [in German] Tell me your name.
[in German] I'll listen out for you.
Szpilman.
Szpilman.
[in German] Good name for a pianist.
[woman shouts] German! German!
No! Don't shoot! I'm, I'm Polish!
-[gunshot] -Please! I'm Polish!
translation.ko: 아니에요, 쏘지 말아요 폴란드 사람이에요! 제발! 폴란드 사람이에요

translation.en: -[gunshot] -I'm...
[Polish Officer shouts] Come out with your hands up! [Wladek] Please! I beg of you!
Don't shoot, don't shoot, don't shoot. I beg you, I'm a Polish, please.
[Polish Officer shouts] Come down!
Please, I'm Polish! Please... please.
[Polish Officer] He's Polish.
[Polish Officer #2] Yes, he's Polish.
[Polish Officer #2] Why the fucking coat?
I'm cold.
Look at them. German fuckers!
[Lednicki] Murderers! Murderers!
-Dirty bastards! -[Lednicki] Assassins!
translation.ko: - 더러운 개자식들! - 이걸 기도해왔는데 - 눈으로 직접 보게 될 줄이야 - 암살자들! 개자식들!

translation.en: -[Polish man] Bastards! -[Lednicki] Look at you now!
translation.ko: - 눈으로 직접 보게 될 줄이야 - 암살자들! 개자식들! 너희들 꼴 좀 봐 내 모든 걸 빼앗아 갔어

translation.en: You took everything I had. Me, a musician.
translation.ko: 너희들 꼴 좀 봐 내 모든 걸 빼앗아 갔어 난 음악가인데 내 바이올린도 영혼도 가져갔어

translation.en: You took my violin, you took my soul!
translation.ko: 난 음악가인데 내 바이올린도 영혼도 가져갔어

translation.en: [in German] Musician?
[in German] Yes.
[in German] Do you know a pianist named Szpilman?
[in German] Polish radio?
[in German] Of course I know him.
[in German] I helped him when he was in hiding. Tell him I'm here.
-[Russian Guard speaking Russian] -[Captain in German] Ask him to help me.
translation.ko: 내가 여기 있다고 전해줘 도와달라고 전해줘

translation.en: [in German] What's your name?
[German Officer] Hosenfeld.
[Lednicki] It was here, I'm certain of it.
[Wladek] Well, it's not here now.
[Lednicki] I shouted, abuse at them. I'm not proud of it but that's what I did.
translation.ko: 내가 욕설을 퍼부었어 자랑할 건 아니지만 그런 짓을 했어

translation.en: [Lednicki] And I'm certain I stood where you are now.
[Lednicki] There was barbed wire, and this German came up to me.
translation.ko: 철조망 안에서 그 독일인이 내게 다가왔어

translation.en: -[Wladek] You didn't catch his name? -No.
I'll ask at the factory. They may know something.
